description: Climate science and environmental policy claims

cases.claim: Global average temperatures have risen 1.1°C above pre-industrial levels
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: IPCC AR6 confirms 1.1°C warming above 1850-1900 baseline as of 2023
NASA GISS records show 2023 was hottest year on record at +1.17°C

cases.claim: Summer Arctic sea ice will disappear completely before 2040
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: Multiple models project ice-free summers by 2030s-2050s depending on emissions
September 2023 sea ice extent was 4.23M km², 6th lowest on record

cases.claim: Solar energy is now the cheapest form of electricity in history
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: IEA World Energy Outlook 2023 confirms solar PV LCOE at $20-60/MWh, cheapest in most markets
Lazard LCOE analysis v17 shows unsubsidized utility-scale solar at $24-96/MWh

cases.claim: Carbon capture technology can solve climate change without reducing emissions
cases.label: REFUTED

evidence_packets.summary: Current global CCS capacity is 42 MtCO2/yr vs 37 GtCO2 annual emissions (0.1%)
IPCC states CCS is complementary to, not a substitute for, emissions reductions

cases.claim: Electric vehicles have lower lifecycle emissions than ICE vehicles globally
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: ICCT study shows EVs produce 50-70% fewer lifecycle CO2 emissions in EU, US, China
Battery manufacturing emissions offset within 1.5-2 years of driving

cases.claim: Sea levels will rise 1 meter by 2100 under current emission trajectories
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: IPCC projects 0.43-0.84m rise by 2100 under SSP2-4.5 (middle scenario)
Ice-sheet instability could add 0.5m+ but probability poorly constrained

cases.claim: Amazon deforestation rates dropped significantly under Lula's government in 2023
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: INPE satellite data shows 22% reduction in Amazon deforestation Aug 2022-Jul 2023 vs prior year
Cerrado deforestation increased 43% in same period, offsetting some gains

cases.claim: Methane is responsible for 30% of global warming since pre-industrial times
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: UNEP Global Methane Assessment attributes 0.5°C of warming to methane
Methane concentrations reached 1,923 ppb in 2023, up 160% from pre-industrial

cases.claim: Nuclear power is essential for achieving net-zero emissions
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: IEA Net Zero 2050 scenario doubles nuclear capacity; other scenarios achieve NZ without it
New nuclear costs are 3-5x higher per MWh than solar/wind in most markets

cases.claim: Climate change has doubled the frequency of extreme weather events since 1980
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: EM-DAT records 3x increase in recorded weather disasters; better reporting is a factor
Attribution studies confirm climate change intensifies extremes but doubling varies by type

cases.claim: Carbon taxes are the most cost-effective way to reduce emissions
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: IMF analysis finds carbon pricing most economically efficient; $75/tonne could cut emissions 25%
British Columbia's carbon tax reduced emissions 5-15% with minimal GDP impact

cases.claim: 50% of the world's coral reefs have died since 1950
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Global Coral Reef Monitoring Network reports 14% loss in just 2009-2018
Cumulative loss estimated at 50% since mid-20th century across Indo-Pacific

cases.claim: Green hydrogen will replace natural gas in industry by 2040
cases.label: REFUTED

evidence_packets.summary: Green hydrogen costs $3-8/kg vs $0.50-1.50/kg for natural gas equivalent
IEA projects green hydrogen meeting only 10% of industrial energy by 2040

cases.claim: Permafrost thaw could release enough carbon to raise temperatures by 0.5°C
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: Estimated 1,400 GtC in permafrost; models suggest 5-15% release by 2100
Feedback loop timing highly uncertain; could range 0.1-0.5°C additional warming

cases.claim: Climate change will create 200 million refugees by 2050
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: World Bank Groundswell report projects 216M internal climate migrants by 2050
Actual cross-border climate migration hard to quantify; economic factors intertwined

cases.claim: We are in a sixth mass extinction driven by human activity
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Current extinction rates 100-1,000x higher than background rate
Living Planet Index shows 69% decline in wildlife populations since 1970

cases.claim: Solar geoengineering could safely cool the planet by 1°C
cases.label: REFUTED

evidence_packets.summary: Models show SAI could reduce warming but with uneven regional effects
Termination shock risk: stopping SAI could cause rapid 2-4°C rebound

cases.claim: Animal agriculture accounts for 14.5% of global greenhouse gas emissions
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: FAO assessment confirms 14.5% figure including feed, processing, transport
Some newer estimates place it at 16-20% when including land-use change

cases.claim: No major economy is on track to meet its Paris Agreement commitments
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Climate Action Tracker rates zero G20 countries as '1.5°C compatible' as of Nov 2023
Global emissions hit 37.4 GtCO2 in 2023, a new record

cases.claim: Ocean acidification threatens to collapse marine food chains by 2100
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: Ocean pH has dropped 0.1 units since pre-industrial (26% acidity increase)
Shell-forming organisms affected, but ecosystem-level collapse uncertain under moderate scenarios
